Ingredients:

  • 1 cup dried kidney beans, soaked in water overnight
  • 1/4 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 large onion, diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 cup chopped fresh parsley
  • 1 cup chopped fresh cilantro
  • 1 cup chopped fresh dill
  • 1/2 cup chopped fresh fenugreek leaves (optional)
  • 1/4 cup dried lime powder (can be found at most Middle Eastern or Persian markets)
  • 1 tsp ground turmeric
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 cups water
  • 1 pound beef stew meat, cut into small cubes

Instructions:

  1. Drain the soaked kidney beans and rinse them under cold water.
  2. In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
  3. Add the parsley, cilantro, dill, and fenugreek (if using) to the pot and sauté for an additional 5 minutes.
  4. Add the lime powder, turmeric, salt, and pepper to the pot and stir well to combine.
  5. Add the beef cubes to the pot and stir to coat them with the herb mixture.
  6. Add the drained kidney beans and 2 cups of water to the pot and stir to combine.
  7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 1 hour or until the beef is tender.
  8. Serve hot over steamed rice. Enjoy!

I hope you enjoy this delicious and unique Persian dish! Let me know if you have any questions or need any clarification on the recipe.
